kernfrasen: The whole world is sick, cancerous, tumor-ridden, 'terminal'
dominion of the Messiah and his victory
not strapped in properly for our journey

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The whole world is sick, cancerous, tumor-ridden, 'terminal'.

cognitieve_implicaties: The condition is internal and self-replicating
The patient is helpless to cure themselves
theologische_implicaties: Sin is not just an act but a state of being
Grace must be an external intervention (Physician)
ethische_implicaties: Focus on seeking 'treatment' (faith) rather than 'moral effort'
onbedoelde_consequenties: May remove moral agency if sin is viewed purely as a disease one 'catches'

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'Sin as Sickness' metaphor by using visceral, modern medical trauma (brain tumors, CAT scans) rather than generic 'healing'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully weaves the medical trauma of her daughter's tumor with the military/political language of Paul's 'dominion'. The bridge is the concept of 'powerlessness'.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Shifts from a state of internal healing to external safety equipment.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Healing implies internal change; being 'strapped in' implies external protection from a dangerous environment.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Uses the 'quantifiable data' of a medical report to validate the 'objective reality' of Paul's theological claims.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses a deeply personal, high-stakes narrative to make the abstract concept of 'deliverance' cognitively accessible.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The description of the four-hour wait for CAT scan results.

risicos.beschrijving: By framing sin as a 'contagion' or 'tumor', the element of human choice/will in sinning is minimized.
risicos.voorbeeld: The contagion of Adam’s disobedience has caused the disobedience of the entire race.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants may view themselves as victims of sin rather than perpetrators.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; uses the emotional 'relief' of the office to explain the 'joy' of the Gospel.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Framed as the one who provides the 'clear CAT scan' when all hope is lost.

verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Sin as a lethal, objective dominion.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the 'Second Sunday after Pentecost' theme of the power of the Spirit/Grace over the Law.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Medical and Military domains. It avoids the Economic domain (debt/payment) almost entirely, focusing instead on 'deliverance' from a 'condition' and an 'empire'. This creates a powerful sense of relief but risks a passive view of the Christian life.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Introduce the idea of 'cost' to balance the medical imagery.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The 'cost' of the medical treatment or the 'price' of the trip.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Connect the 'lack of safety straps' more clearly to the 'internal sickness'—perhaps as a failure of the 'immune system' of the soul.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If sin is a tumor, is the sinner 'guilty' or just 'unlucky'?
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Re-introduce the 'Adam's choice' element more forcefully to maintain moral weight.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe being 'in Christ' as a new foundation or building, providing a more stable container than a roller coaster.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using personal narrative to ground high-level Pauline theology in embodied experience.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT reveals that the 'tumor' story isn't just a 'moving illustration' but the cognitive lens through which the congregation understands 'Grace'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's learning cycles, CMT focuses on the mapping of the 'fear of death' to the 'theology of the Fall'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Identifies that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (falling out of a coaster) and 'Container' (Empire of Evil) to describe the human condition.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Snatched out of the jaws of death
appendices.notities: The preacher uses Reagan-era political language ('Empire of Evil') to ground the military domain in the 1987 context.
